definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth

sentences.english: I strongly believe that Japanese high school girls are the sexiest female living creature in this world.
sentences.chinese: 我深信日本女子高生是世上最性感的雌性生物。

sentences.english: I'm convinced the new method won't work but I'll still have to go through the motions .
sentences.chinese: 我深信這個新方法起不了什麼作用，但仍還得走過場。

sentences.english: He knew that without this he cannot win, about that I have no doubt in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 他明白不靠這些他無法獲勝，對此我深信不疑。

sentences.english: He is convinced that his poem will win the award.
sentences.chinese: 他深信自己那首詩會得獎。

sentences.english: When tears slip the destiny chains, I deeply comfirm the unemotional washing-away.
sentences.chinese: 當淚水滑過命運枷鎖，我深信這是無感情的宣泄。

sentences.english: You are a paedophile; I'm deeply convinced.
sentences.chinese: 你是一個戀童癖者，我對此深信不疑。

sentences.english: I began to get cold feet, but the other two guys were totally positive .
sentences.chinese: 我開始動搖，可其他兩個人卻深信不疑。

sentences.english: We are convinced that the team's results are far greater than the sum of individual efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我們深信，團隊協作的成果遠遠大於個人努力的總和。

sentences.english: Rudi was convinced that his brother meant him and his family.
sentences.chinese: 魯迪卻深信他哥哥是在罵他和他的家人。

sentences.english: I am a good accountant and have a thorough knowledge of the English language.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個優秀的會計員，同時深信對英文頗爲熟練。

sentences.english: At 2 A. M. , Mrs. Smith was convinced that she had heard a prowler in the living room.
sentences.chinese: 凌晨2點，史密斯夫人深信她聽到小偷進了客廳。

sentences.english: Some people were convinced that crop circles were sites where alien spaceships had landed.
sentences.chinese: 有些人深信麥田圈是外星人太空船所降落的地方。

sentences.english: But Mr Eide said he believed there were still disagreements.
sentences.chinese: 但是埃德說他深信一定還有很多不同的意見。

sentences.english: They have always believed deeply that incentives are key .
sentences.chinese: 他們一向深信物質刺激是關鍵。

sentences.english: Faith is the bird that fells the light when the dawn still dark.
sentences.chinese: 信仰如小鳥在黑暗的黎明仍然深信不疑。

sentences.english: Art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them that are in darkness.
sentences.chinese: 又深信自己是瞎子的響導，是黑暗中人的光明。

definition: to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
to be convinced/to be sure/to firmly believe/to be positive that/definite news
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
to know well/to be fully aware of
to be bound to/to be sure to
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
